IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: ANGELS' PLACE IS A NOT-FOR-PROFIT CORPORATION ORGANIZED TO PROVIDE HOMES AND HOPE FOR INDIVIDUALS WITH DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES IN SOUTHEASTERN MICHIGAN.ANGELS' PLACE WAS FOUNDED TO MEET THE NEEDS OF AGING PARENTS OF ADULT CHILDREN WITH DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES, TO RESPOND TO THE UNCERTAINTY THAT EVERY PARENT OF A CHILD WITH A DISABILITY HAS, AND TO ADDRESS THE QUESTION: WHO WILL CARE FOR MY ADULT CHILD WHEN I AM NO LONGER HERE TO DO SO?IT IS THE INTENT OF ANGELS' PLACE TO PROVIDE CARE THROUGH VARIOUS PHASES OF LIFE, INCLUDING THE MANY COMPLEXITIES OF AGING. ON AVERAGE, ANGELS' PLACE ANTICIPATES PROVIDING 30-40 YEARS OF SERVICE FOR EACH OF OUR RESIDENTS. THEREFORE, OUR PLANNING, OUR GROWTH AND OUR FISCAL MANAGEMENT MUST BE PRUDENT AND ENDURING. FINANCIAL SUSTAINABILITY IS ESSENTIAL TO THE ORGANIZATION'S EFFECTIVENESS IN MEETING THE LIFE-LONG NEEDS OF EACH PERSON SERVED TODAY AND THOSE TO BE SERVED IN THE FUTURE.
IRS990.MissionDesc: ANGELS' PLACE OFFERS AN ENVIRONMENT OF LOVE AND COMPASSION, COUPLED WITH AN ATMOSPHERE OF ACCEPTANCE, DIGNITY, FRIENDSHIP AND THE POTENTIAL FOR PERSONAL GROWTH AND INDEPENDENCE. WE ARE A CHRIST-CENTERED COMMUNITY THAT ENHANCES THE LIVES OF THOSE WE SERVE AND THEIR FAMILIES BY PROVIDING LOVING HOMES AND PROFESSIONAL SUPPORT TO INDIVIDUALS WITH INTELLECTUAL AND DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES.
IRS990.Desc: ANGELS' PLACE PROVIDES HOMES AND SUPPORT TO 92 ADULTS WITH DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES. WE CURRENTLY OPERATE 21 HOMES. OURFOCUS IS PROVIDING CHRISTIAN, FAMILY-LIKE ENVIRONMENTS. WE TRAINAND/OR ASSIST WITH ALL ASPECTS OF ADULT DAILY LIVING INCLUDING PERSONALGROOMING, HOUSEKEEPING, MEAL PREPARATION, EMPLOYMENT ANDRECREATION. THE ENRICHMENT PROGRAM SERVES INDIVIDUALS DURING THEWEEKDAYS THAT ARE UNEMPLOYED OR UNDER-EMPLOYED, AND PROVIDESAN OPPORTUNITY TO DEVELOP, MAINTAIN AND ENHANCE SKILLS THAT WILLASSIST THEM WITH IMPROVING THEIR EMPLOYMENT READINESS, LIVINGINDEPENDENTLY, CONTRIBUTING TO THEIR COMMUNITY IN A MEANINGFUL WAY, AND LIVING A HAPPY AND FULFILLED LIFE. THIS PROGRAM SERVESAPPROXIMATELY 45 PEOPLE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ENDOWMENT DONATIONS AND MARKET VALUE GAINS/LOSSES ARE HELD PERMANENTLY BY ANGELS' PLACE IN LONG-TERM INVESTMENTS. THE INTEREST AND DIVIDENDS FROM THE ENDOWMENT FUNDS ARE UNRESTRICTED AND CAN BE USED FOR ANY OPERATING PURPOSE. THE ENDOWMENT FUNDS INCLUDE FUNDS HELD AT AN UNRELATED ORGANIZATION FOR THE BENEFIT OF ANGELS' PLACE. THESE FUNDS ARE NOT RECORDED ON THE FINANCIAL STATMENTS OF ANGELS' PLACE AS THEY ARE SUBJECT TO VARIANCE POWER MAINTAINED BY THE UNRELATED ORGANIZATION.
DIRECT EXPENSES FOR GAMING & FUNDRAISING ACTIVITIES 47,724.
DIRECT EXPENSES FOR GAMING & FUNDRAISING ACTIVITIES 47,724.
CAROLE KARBON, THE DEVELOPMENT ASSISTANT AT ANGELS' PLACE, PERFORMS DUTIES SUCH AS RECORDKEEPING AND THE COUNTING OF MONIES. HER COMPENSATION FOR THESE DUTIES IS $1,500.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: LORETTA NAGLE RYAN AND CHRIS NAGLE ARE MOTHER AND SON.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 IS REVIEWED BY THE FINANCE COMMITTEE AND THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE BEFORE BEING PRESENTED TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS FOR REVIEW AND APPROVAL.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BOARD MEMBERS ARE ASKED ANNUALLY TO SIGN A DISCLOSURE FORM INDICATING ANY CONFLICTS OR POTENTIAL CONFLICTS. ITEMS NOTED ON THE FORMS ARE REVIEWED BY THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE TO DETERMINE IF THE BOARD MEMBER SHOULD BE EXCUSED FROM VOTING ON MATTERS RELATED TO THE CONFLICT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CEO'S PERFORMANCE IS REVIEWED BY THE CHAIRMAN OF THE BOARD AND THE CHAIR OF THE HR COMMITTEE. MERIT INCREASE IS APPROVED BY THEM SUBJECT TO SALARY BEING WITHIN THE RANGE OF COMPARABLE DATA FROM THE MICHIGAN NON-PROFIT ASSOCIATION. DIRECTORS ARE REVIEWED BY THOMAS SZCZEPANSKI, AND THEIR COMPENSATION IS EVALUATED AGAINST THE SAME MNA DATA.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.
THERE HAVE BEEN NO CHANGES IN THE PROCESSES USED BY THE AUDIT COMMITTEE IN THE CURRENT YEAR.
